   19: %%
   20: -module(trace_call_memory_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: 
   25: %% Test server callbacks
   26: -export([
   27:     suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   28:     init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   29:     init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   30:     init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   31: 
   32: %% Test cases exports
   33: -export([
   34:     basic/0, basic/1,
   35:     on_load/0, on_load/1,
   36:     late_trace/0, late_trace/1,
   37:     skip/0, skip/1,
   38:     message/0, message/1,
   39:     parallel_map/0, parallel_map/1,
   40:     trace_all/0, trace_all/1,
   41:     spawn_memory/0, spawn_memory/1, spawn_memory_internal/1,
   42:     spawn_memory_lambda/1,
   43:     conflict_traces/0, conflict_traces/1,
   44:     big_words/0, big_words/1
   45: ]).
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   49: 
   50: all() ->
   51:     trace_sessions:all().
   52: 
   53: groups() ->
   54:     trace_sessions:groups(testcases()).
   55: 
   56: testcases() ->
   57:     [basic, on_load, late_trace, skip, message, parallel_map, trace_all, spawn_memory,
   58:     spawn_memory_lambda, conflict_traces, big_words].
   59: 
   60: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   61:     trace_sessions:init_per_suite(Config, ?MODULE).
   62: 
   63: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   64:     trace_sessions:end_per_suite(Config).
   65: 
   66: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
   67:     trace_sessions:init_per_group(Group, Config).
   68: 
   69: end_per_group(Group, Config) ->
   70:     trace_sessions:end_per_group(Group, Config).
   71: 
   72: 
   73: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   74:     trace_sessions:init_per_testcase(Config).
   75: 
   76: end_per_testcase(basic, Config) ->
   77:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0}, false, [call_memory]),
   78:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
   79:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   80: end_per_testcase(on_load, Config) ->
   81:     erlang_trace_pattern({sofs, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   82:     erlang_trace_pattern(on_load, false, [call_memory]),
   83:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
   84:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   85: end_per_testcase(late_trace, Config) ->
   86:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   87:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   88: end_per_testcase(skip, Config) ->
   89:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   90:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
   91:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   92: end_per_testcase(message, Config) ->
   93:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, receive_message, 0}, false, [call_memory]),
   94:     erlang_trace(all, false, [call]),
   95:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   96: end_per_testcase(parallel_map, Config) ->
   97:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   98:     erlang_trace(all, false, [call]),
   99:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
  100: end_per_testcase(trace_all, Config) ->
  101:     erlang_trace_pattern({'_', '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
  102:     erlang_trace(all, false, [call]),
  103:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
  104: end_per_testcase(spawn_memory, Config) ->
  105:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
  106:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
  107:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
  108: end_per_testcase(spawn_memory_lambda, Config) ->
  109:     erlang_trace_pattern({erlang, apply, 2}, false, [call_memory]),
  110:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
  111:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
  112: end_per_testcase(conflict_traces, Config) ->
  113:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
  114:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
  115:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
  116: end_per_testcase(big_words, Config) ->
  117:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE,alloc_tuples,2}, false, [call_memory]),
  118:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
  119:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config).
  120: 
  121: 
  122: erlang_trace(A,B,C) ->
  123:     trace_sessions:erlang_trace(A,B,C).
  124: 
  125: erlang_trace_pattern(A,B,C) ->
  126:     trace_sessions:erlang_trace_pattern(A,B,C).
  127: 
  128: erlang_trace_info(A,B) ->
  129:     trace_sessions:erlang_trace_info(A,B).
  130: 
  131: 
  132: %% allocation functions
  133: alloc_2tup() ->
  134:     {self(),self()}. %% a non literal
  135: 
  136: receive_message() ->
  137:     receive
  138:         Msg -> Msg
  139:     end.
  140: 
  141: basic() ->
  142:     [{doc, "Assert that two-tuple allocated 3-word structure on the heap"}].
  143: 
  144: basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  145:     Self = self(),
  146:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0},
  147:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  148:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  149:     alloc_2tup(),
  150:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  151:     alloc_2tup(),
  152:     {call_memory, [{Self, 2, 6}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  153:     %% test that GC works correctly
  154:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  155:     alloc_2tup(),
  156:     {call_memory, [{Self, 3, 9}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  157:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, false, [call]),
  158:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  159: 
  160: on_load() ->
  161:     [{doc, "Test that on_load works"}].
  162: 
  163: on_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  164: 
  165:     code:purge(sofs),
  166:     code:delete(sofs),
  167:     false = erlang:module_loaded(sofs),
  168: 
  169:     SumAll =
  170:         fun(Module) ->
  171:                 FAs = [{F, A, erlang_trace_info({Module, F, A}, call_memory)}
  172:                        || {F, A} <- Module:module_info(functions),
  173:                           F =/= module_info],
  174:                 lists:sum(
  175:                   lists:flatten(
  176:                     [ [M || {_Pid, _Cnt, M} <- Pids]
  177:                       || {_, _, {call_memory, Pids}} <- FAs]))
  178:         end,
  179: 
  180:     Self = self(),
  181: 
  182:     %% Check that sofs is not traced
  183:     0 = erlang_trace_pattern({sofs,'_','_'}, false, [call_memory]),
  184: 
  185:     0 = erlang_trace_pattern(on_load, true, [call_memory]),
  186:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  187: 
  188:     %% Check that before call, sofs does not have any allocations
  189:     0 = SumAll(sofs),
  190:     %% Call it to allocate some memory
  191:     sofs:relation([{b,1},{c,2},{c,3}]),
  192: 
  193:     %% Check that some memory was allocated
  194:     ?assertNotEqual(0, SumAll(sofs)),
  195: 
  196:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, false, [call]),
  197: 
  198:     %% Verify that some functions had traces on them
  199:     ?assertNotEqual(0, erlang_trace_pattern({sofs,'_','_'}, false, [call_memory])).
  200: 
  201: late_trace() ->
  202:     [{doc, "Tests that garbage_collect call done before tracing is enabled works as expected"}].
  203: 
  204: late_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  205:     Control = self(),
  206:     Pid = spawn_link(
  207:         fun () ->
  208:             _ = late_trace_inner(),
  209:             1 = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, true, [call_memory]),
  210:             1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call]),
  211:             _ = late_trace_inner(),
  212:             Control ! continue,
  213:             receive
  214:                 stop ->
  215:                     1 = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, false, [call_memory])
  216:             end
  217:         end),
  218:     NonLiteral = non_literal_9(),
  219:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  220:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  221:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  222:     receive continue -> ok end,
  223:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 12}]} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, call_memory),
  224:     Pid ! stop,
  225:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end.
  226: 
  227: late_trace_inner() ->
  228:     Ref = alloc_2tup(), %% 3 words
  229:     receive _Msg -> Ref end. %% 9 more words
  230: 
  231: non_literal_9() ->
  232:     %% 9 words in total: 6 words for the list, 3 for the tuple
  233:     erlang:insert_element(2, erlang:insert_element(1, {}, atom), lists:seq(1, 3)).
  234: 
  235: skip() ->
  236:     [{doc, "Tests that skipped trace for a function accumulates in an upper level caller"}].
  237: 
  238: skip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  239:     Self = self(),
  240:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, upper, 0}, true, [call_memory]),
  241:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, lower, 1}, true, [call_memory]),
  242:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  243:     upper(),
  244:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 8 * 2}]} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, lower, 1}, call_memory),
  245:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3 + 3 + 6}]} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, upper, 0}, call_memory).
  246: 
  247: upper() ->
  248:     Ref = alloc_2tup(),          %% 3
  249:     X = middle(Ref),            %% 3 in middle, and 8 in lower (but lower has its own accounting)
  250:     {1, 2, 3, X, Ref}.          %% extra 6 words (5 elements and 1 tuple size)
  251: 
  252: middle(_Ref) ->
  253:     Ref2 = alloc_2tup(),         %% 3 - but accounted in 'upper/0' instead
  254:     lower(8),
  255:     Ref2.
  256: 
  257: lower(Max) ->
  258:     lists:seq(1, Max).
  259: 
  260: message() ->
  261:     [{doc, "Assert that receiving a message results in memory trace"}].
  262: 
  263: message(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  264:     Control = self(),
  265:     Traced = {?MODULE, receive_message, 0},
  266:     NonLiteral = non_literal_9(),
  267:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  268:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  269:     Pid = spawn_link(
  270:         fun Wrap() ->
  271:             receive
  272:                 pre ->
  273:                     receive_message(),
  274:                     Control ! done,
  275:                     Wrap();
  276:                 stop ->
  277:                     ok
  278:             end
  279:         end),
  280:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), false, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  281:     %% first, check that sending a (non-matched) message does not result in a negative allocation
  282:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  283:     timer:sleep(500),
  284:     {call_memory, []} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  285:     %% enter the receive_message/0
  286:     Pid ! pre,
  287:     %% wait for 'done' response
  288:     receive done -> ok end,
  289:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 9}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  290:     %% once again, just in case, to verify that decrementing "allocated" worked
  291:     Pid ! pre,
  292:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  293:     receive done -> ok end,
  294:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 2, 18}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  295:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  296: 
  297: parallel_map() ->
  298:     [{doc, "Test memory profiling with spawned processes"}].
  299: 
  300: parallel_map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  301:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, true, [call_memory]),
  302:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_spawn]),
  303:     Pid = spawn_link(fun do_parallel/0),
  304:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  305:     Pid ! pre_stop,
  306:     Pid ! {stop, 1},
  307:     receive
  308:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} ->
  309:             %% alloc_2tup called 3 times (once per process)
  310:             {call_memory, [{_, 1, 3}, {_, 1, 3}, {_, 1, 3}]} =
  311:                 erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0}, call_memory),
  312:             %% receive_message called 8 times (3 from "Allocs", 3 from "Grand", and 2 from the runner)
  313:             %%  from 7 processes, but only 3*6 Grand processes and 3 words for the runner are on the heap
  314:             {call_memory, RecvMsg} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, receive_message, 0}, call_memory),
  315:             {7, 8, 21} = collapse_procs(RecvMsg)
  316:     end.
  317: 
  318: do_parallel() ->
  319:     Allocs = [spawn_monitor(fun() -> alloc_2tup(), receive_message() end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 3)],
  320:     Grand = [spawn_monitor(fun() -> receive_message() end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 3)],
  321:     pre_stop = receive_message(),
  322:     [P ! {atom, <<"1234">>} || {P,_} <- Grand], %% 3 words on the heap for tuple (binary is literal)
  323:     {stop, 1} = receive_message(),
  324:     [P ! atom || {P,_} <- Allocs], %% no words on the heap for atom
  325:     [receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, P, normal} -> ok end || {P,MRef} <- Allocs++Grand].
  326: 
  327: trace_all() ->
  328:     [{doc, "Enables memory tracing for all processes, mainly ensuring there are no core dumps"}].
  329: 
  330: trace_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  331:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({'_', '_', '_'}, true, [call_memory]),
  332:     _ = erlang_trace(all, true, [call]),
  333:     do_heavy_lifting(),
  334:     _ = erlang_trace(all, false, [call]),
  335:     Profile = profile_memory(),
  336:     %% it'd be better to introduce more checks, but for now see that
  337:     %%  at least some action happened
  338:     true = is_map_key(application_controller, Profile).
  339: 
  340: do_heavy_lifting() ->
  341:     {ok, []} = application:ensure_all_started(kernel).
  342: 
  343: profile_memory() ->
  344:     profile_modules(code:all_loaded(), #{}).
  345: 
  346: profile_modules([], Acc) ->
  347:     Acc;
  348: profile_modules([{Module, _} | Tail], Acc) ->
  349:     Funcs = try Module:module_info(functions)
  350:             catch error:undef -> [] % ignore homebrewed without module_info
  351:             end,
  352:     case profile_functions(Module, Funcs, #{}) of
  353:         Empty when Empty =:= #{} ->
  354:             profile_modules(Tail, Acc);
  355:         NonEmpty ->
  356:             profile_modules(Tail, Acc#{Module => NonEmpty})
  357:     end.
  358: 
  359: profile_functions(_Module, [], Acc) ->
  360:     Acc;
  361: profile_functions(Module, [{Fun, Arity} | Tail], Acc) ->
  362:     case erlang_trace_info({Module, Fun, Arity}, call_memory) of
  363:         {call_memory, Skip} when Skip =:= []; Skip =:= false ->
  364:             profile_functions(Module, Tail, Acc);
  365:         {call_memory, Mem} ->
  366:             profile_functions(Module, Tail, Acc#{{Fun, Arity} => collapse_procs(Mem)})
  367:     end.
  368: 
  369: collapse_procs(Processes) ->
  370:     lists:foldl(
  371:         fun ({_Pid, Calls, Words}, {Procs, TotCalls, TotWords}) ->
  372:             {Procs + 1, TotCalls + Calls, TotWords + Words}
  373:         end, {0, 0, 0}, Processes).
  374: 
  375: spawn_memory() ->
  376:     [{doc, "Tests that when a process is spawned, initial memory correctly attributed to the initial call"}].
  377: 
  378: spawn_memory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  379:     LostSharing = lists:seq(1, 16),
  380:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, 1}, true, [call_memory]),
  381:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  382:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, [LostSharing]),
  383:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  384:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  385:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), false, [all]),
  386:     %% 16-elements list translates into 34-words for spawn
  387:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 34}]} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, 1}, call_memory).
  388: 
  389: spawn_memory_lambda(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  390:     %% check that tracing with context captured through lambda also works - but reports erlang:apply
  391:     LostSharing = lists:seq(1, 16),
  392:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({erlang, apply, 2}, true, [call_memory]),
  393:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  394:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(fun () -> spawn_memory_internal(LostSharing) end),
  395:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  396:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  397:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), false, [all]),
  398:     %% 16-elements list translates into 34-words for spawn, and 4 more words for apply itself
  399:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 37}]} = erlang_trace_info({erlang, apply, 2}, call_memory).
  400: 
  401: spawn_memory_internal(Array) ->
  402:     Array.
  403: 
  404: conflict_traces() ->
  405:     [{doc, "Verify that call_time and call_memory don't break each other"}].
  406: 
  407: conflict_traces(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  408:     Self = self(),
  409:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0},
  410:     %% start call_memory trace
  411:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  412:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  413:     alloc_2tup(),
  414:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  415:     %% start/stop call_time trace
  416:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_time]),
  417:     alloc_2tup(), %% this goes to both time and memory
  418:     {call_time, [{Self, 1, _, _}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_time),
  419:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_time]),
  420:     %% memory is unaffected
  421:     alloc_2tup(),
  422:     {call_memory, [{Self, 3, 9}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  423:     %%
  424:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, false, [call]),
  425:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  426: 
  427: big_words() ->
  428:     [{doc, "Test that Words counter can be a bignum on 32-bit"}].
  429: 
  430: big_words(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  431:     Self = self(),
  432:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_tuples, 2},
  433:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  434:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  435:     Words = (1 bsl 27),
  436:     case {erts_debug:size(Words), 8*erlang:system_info(wordsize)} of
  437:         {2, 32} -> ok;
  438:         {0, 64} -> ok
  439:     end,
  440:     TupleSz = 1023,
  441:     TupleCnt = Words div (TupleSz + 1),
  442:     alloc_tuples(TupleCnt, TupleSz),
  443:     CallCnt = TupleCnt + 1,
  444:     {call_memory, [{Self, CallCnt, Words}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  445:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, false, [call]),
  446:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  447: 
  448: 
  449: alloc_tuples(0, _) ->
  450:     ok;
  451: alloc_tuples(N, TupleSz) ->
  452:     erlang:make_tuple(TupleSz, []),
  453:     alloc_tuples(N-1, TupleSz).
